answers.content_html: It is the heat that must transfer energy to or from a system in order to cause a mass change with a slight change in the temperature of the system.
answers.feedback_html: Latent heat is not responsible for mass change. It is responsible for phase change at constant temperature.

answers.content_html: It is the heat that must transfer energy to or from a system in order to cause a mass change without a temperature change in the system.
answers.feedback_html: Latent heat is not responsible for mass change. It is responsible for phase change at constant temperature.

answers.content_html: It is the heat that must transfer energy to or from a system in order to cause a phase change with a slight change in the temperature of the system.
answers.feedback_html: A phase change occurs without a temperature change in the system.

answers.content_html: It is the heat that must transfer energy to or from a system in order to cause a phase change without a temperature change in the system.
answers.feedback_html: Yes, latent heat indicates the heat that must transfer energy to or from a system in order to cause a phase change, during which there is no temperature change in the system.
Latent heat is in \text{SI} units of energy per mass.
Latent heat is in \text{SI} units of energy per mass. This is the product of energy and mass.
Joules and calories are both units of energy, can calories are not \text{SI}.
This is a possible unit for latent heat, but calories are not an \text{SI} unit of energy.

stem_html: What are the SI units of latent heat?
